titles: The run-awayes routed: or, A whip for Momus. Being an answer, and a confutation, against the run-awayes, and their vindication.
notes: Verse: "Off with your doublet sirrah, come you ass,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Charles II, 1660-1685 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
